comment: I took this class over the summer, and I shouldn't have this professor was inactive and didn't teach, if you are the type of student who can teach themselves then go for it. But this class is not good if not, all he did was provide other people's YouTube videos on how to solve some of the problems and nothing himself. BEWHERE DOES NOT TEACH HIMSELF

Not a single lecture was his own, we exclusively learned from a textbook that was hard to understand and a guy on YouTube named Patrick J. If you already know the material this class would be easy for you, but if you need to learn it for the first time good luck. You can get the right answer, but if it's not done his way you don't get credit.
Fun
rating_tags: Tough grader--Test heavy--Graded by few things

comment: Doesn't care about how hard you try and quizzes were nothing like the final!

He was horrible when I took him, I'll never forget he said, "I sometimes go on rate my professor and delete the bad ratings". He had such a weird teaching style I was lost even when I tried to get extra help. I went on to take calc again with Prof Puckett and passed with a B! With that being said go to a professor who will actually help you.
rating_tags: Tough grader--Test heavy--Graded by few things

comment: Glasgo was amazing for ODE. His lectures might not be the best, but he always goes over relevant problems and examples during class. Homework is optional, but I highly recommend in order to do well. Genuinely a good dude.

The class is hard no matter the professor. Extremely good and helpful in class lectures and lots of non-mandatory homework. 5 midterms which are usually hard, including a curveball question from the homework. Can exempt the final if you get an A.

Very lazy professor. Makes exams very short and always puts in questions that he didn't go over in lecture. I have taken him before and the only good thing was that he gave a lot of extra credit, but since he stopped doing that the class is horrible. He also forces you to do group projects. Overall, not great at teaching or testing, don't recommend

One of my favorite professors! I did all the extra credit and was able to skip the final and have an A in the class. I needed a 20-30% on the final to get an A+. He is so nice and caring, amazing at teaching, patient (and cool!) I wanted him for calc three, but I couldn't get him. I cannot stress enough how good he is at teaching!

Attendance not mandatory, but there was a quiz every week unless we had an exam. Grading was based on a point system ergo you needed 120 points to have a C or like 250 for a B. I liked that about the class though. You could skip the final alltogether if you had enough points. There is a chunk of extra credit so that was awesome. He does go fast tho

I do not get all the bad reviews here,  he not only offered extra credit multiple times through extra study assignments, but also made it to where finishing the HW was extra credit itself. He had very engaging lectures for a calc two class and made sure to explain anything that wasn't understood before moving on. hes the goat.
The worst teacher I ever had. Do not take him he is the harshest grader ever. I've never failed a class in my life and this is the first one I've ever failed. Do not take him if you want to pass.

Dr. Glasgo seems like a chill guy and was always nice when I and others asked for help with homework problems. Tests and quizzes follow the same format as the homework. Make sure you show up to lecture every day, because you'll miss a lot if you don't. There's also a lot of easy extra credit early on in the semester.

I took the summer course so it was condensed. He was very easy to contact, helped me so much through difficult problems, and provided great feedback. A good bit of homework, the textbook isn't very useful though. Both the quizzes and final aren't super hard but you don't have much room for error. Loved his class, plan to take his courses again.
rating_tags: Tough grader--Lots of homework--Accessible outside class

comment: HORRIBLE. Doesn't care about you or your success. Harsh grader, gives 0 partial credit. Seems mad when you try to ask for help. Horrible grading system too. Very stuck up and shows no compassion. No makeup test. No study guide. Weekly quizzes, no partial credit.. it's either right or a 0%. Please save yourself the stress.
Test are nothing like notes, very picky grader you will need a tutor for this class if you take him

I thought he was a fantastic professor! He explained things very well and was always willing to slow down or go back to a topic if you were confused. He was kind and professional, and the tests were not that much different from the homework. The class itself was very difficult but thats just because it was differential equations.

my grade in the class was my own fault lol. literally just do the hw, txtbook exercises, and watch the videos. and make you understand the concept and not just how to do it. dr. glasgo makes the class easier than it is.
rating_tags: Participation matters--Lots of homework--Graded by few things

comment: WORST PROFESSOR EVER!! if you can take anyone else then please do so for your own sake, future you will thank you. I've never had a strong problem with understanding the way professors explained things but I did with him. he said said tests were like homework and notes but they were not at all. his SI was a better teacher than him. save yourself!!!
A very picky grader can never make any mistakes. Test also do not match with lecture or notes.

I had to study over 12 hours a week for this class, I had to also use outside resources to learn because the lecture is different from the homework and test which is unbelievable since I paid for this class. He needs to be more lenient and solve the problem all the way not just half and expect us to know how to do the other half

He will fail you even if you have the right answer saying it has to be his way or it doesnt count, and on a graph that straight forward he failed my answers when they were right saying i looked like i didnt know what i was doing. And his form of extra credit is just giving super hard quizzes and no study guides at all for any quizzes or tests.

This was the worst professor I've taken since being in college. He stops working problems halfway and is such a picky grader, there is 3 test and 1 final the 3 test were nothing like lecture or the homework so get ready to understand the concepts. The final was nothing like anything we've done in class. Do not take this guy
Nice guy, needs to learn some lecture skills.

Extremely tough grader, the things on the test were nothing like the class, he is an awful professor and needs to learn how to teach the material not just do easy questions in class then give us 20 hard homework questions.

I took calc 2, his class structure is nice however he is an extremely tough grader and goes out of his way to make his test hard. several people approached him and told him we didn't even learn this during the test.

Although this class was a little tough, the professor was very accessible outside of class (yes even on weekends). Attendance wasn't mandatory but I highly recommend coming to class EVERY day. If you missed one class, you missed an entire chapter! I was always looking forward to his class. If you don't understand a problem, he will help you!
Wouldn't recommend this professor. Didn't teach the material well. Very nonchalant and was a tough grader. Do not take him for this course!.
rating_tags: Tough grader--Beware of pop quizzes--Lecture heavy

comment: He was pretty good! Calc 3 isn't the easiest subject, but he made it hard to fail the course. Fairly easy and practical grader. Explained complex ideas clearly and was always available. Allowed test corrections, extra credit, and dropped 6 HW grades. HW is on MLM and he chose Qs from the textbook. 4 exams and a final. Would recommend! Nice guy.

HW graded for completion and most answers are in the back of the book. very receptive to class so if the whole class ask for some type of EC he'll probably give it, option to skip final if you want to and keep your grade in D2L, short test though so their kinda hard, he had some review games that helped and his office hours help alot

Mr. Glasgo was very sweet but he didn't share the class slides, it was either pay attention to the lecture or take notes and study later. Also, he talks too fast and doesn't explain well the topics' connection to each other. Homework every week, 4 exams, final exam, and a lot of extra credit (although is too much work to get them, 300problems)

If you want an A in his class you NEED to do your homework, go to class, & study early. I took calc in HS, but I was consistently getting 80s on exams. The class averages were around the 50% - 60% mark, & people were visibly struggling in the class. He's a very sweet guy, and is definitely passionate about his work, but you must to participate.
Dr. Glasgo really cares about the well-being of his students. Discrete Math is hard regardless of who you take, but he's extremely accessible outside the classroom.

for MATH2345. Lots of homework because math needs it... just do it. Don't listen to other lazy people on here who don't want to work. He rewards those who put in effort. Ask questions, participate. Don't be shy. You get out of life what you put in. Don't expect it to be handed to you. Great professor, he cares about your learning.
rating_tags: EXTRA CREDIT--Gives good feedback--Lots of homework

comment: Definitely new but improving. He's trying a new test style but seems to be struggling to make tests doable within the allotted time. Homework takes a while and the textbook is absolute crap. Highly recommend going to his office hours/make study groups. Numerical is a tough subject and he's still learning how to teach it. Great teacher otherwise.
rating_tags: Get ready to read--Lots of homework--Accessible outside class

comment: Although it's evident he is relatively new to teaching, he continuously tries to get better. Very passionate about the subject matter and it shows. Always available for questions before and after class. There is a lot of homework and his grading style for it (2 random questions for correctness) is not the best, but otherwise a great professor.

Dr. Glasgo is visibly new to being a professor. His lectures can be a bit hard to follow at times, largely because he is still refining his teaching style. That being said, I have not seen another professor who is nearly as willing to put in the time and effort to help you succeed. Hard work and willingness to seek help pay dividends in his class.

i got an A+ in calculus all thanks to him. if you are willing to actually put in the work, he is the most thoughtful caring professor in the world. he is incredibly helpful and genuinely wants you to succeed.

This class was hard but Dr. Glasgo is a great guy and he wants you to succeed. There are 4 tests which are very hard and do not resemble the homework, or the notes , the class average was always very low HOWEVER he lets you do test corrections for FULL CREDIT. If you go to his office hours and do test corrections this class is not bad at all.
rating_tags: Accessible outside class--Skip class? You won't pass.--Group projects

comment: Try your best to keep up with him during the lectures, it can be a lot at once. ASK QUESTIONS and go to office hours! It's the difference between passing and failing. Weekly quizzes and four exams. Group projects include teaching the class sections out of the textbook. He's not the worst professor I've ever had but the class could've gone better.

I took this math class on marietta campus as a biology major. My last math class needed and it is way different than I had pictured. He doesn't slow or down or explain things well at all. Assumed that I ever took calculus before.
rating_tags: Skip class? You won't pass.--Group projects--Tough grader

comment: I see a lot of negative reviews here. I took him during his 2nd semester teaching and it seems like he really improved from the first semester. I enjoyed his class and he was super lenient and understanding about stuff. I would recommend him for sure. He does not deserve the rating he has right now.
rating_tags: Gives good feedback--Accessible outside class--EXTRA CREDIT

comment: Tests were bad, not enough time for the amount of questions given. He thought he fixed it, he didn't. Does not accept criticism well. Can't teach to save his life. I would definitely avoid him. This was his first semester teaching, I hate being a guinea pig. The test average was 35% before the takehome corrections that gave you some points back.
Bad teacher, dont take him. My honest review got taken down 3 times

Professor did not teach at all. The class was more here is the hw and if you have any questions, ask in the virtual class. When asked to change teaching style, was unwilling. Tests were extremely difficult as they were too lengthy for the allotted time given. Avoid taking Numerical Methods with this teacher.
